NEW DELHI: In a thrilling encounter at Kolkata's home ground, the Rajasthan Royals outshone the Kolkata Knight Riders in a dramatic twist during match 31 of IPL 2024. The match witnessed an extraordinary performance by KKR's Sunil Narine, who, in a surprising turn of events, scored his first T20 century. Narine's aggressive 109 off 56 balls, featuring 13 boundaries and 6 sixes, nearly pushed KKR to the 200-run mark.The clash between the IPL 2024 IPL 2024 points table toppers Rajasthan Royals and the second-placed Kolkata Knight Riders was a high-scoring affair, with over 440 runs tallied.Both teams saw centurions in their ranks, with Jos Buttler's unbeaten 107 off 60 balls for Rajasthan Royals matching Narine's spectacular innings, reshaping the Orange Cap race.Virat Kohli continues to lead the Orange Cap standings with most runs, 361 runs from 7 innings. Riyan Parag follows closely in second place, accumulating 318 runs in 7 innings. Sunil Narine's maiden IPL century propels him to third place with 276 runs in 6 innings, while Sanju Samson, the Rajasthan Royals' captain, occupies the fourth spot with 276 runs from 7 innings. His brilliant 105 off just 63 balls not only showcased his skill but also added an electrifying element to the contest for the prestigious cap.

Article Title: Harbhajan Singh takes a dig at Riyan Parag, says learn from Jos Buttler
Article Text:
WATCH:

NEW DELHI: Jos Buttler sat out Rajasthan Royals' match against Punjab Kings due to injury, but upon his return, the Englishman orchestrated a remarkable performance, single-handedly leading his team to IPL's record chase against Kolkata Knight Riders at the packed Eden Gardens on Wednesday.Facing a daunting task after Sunil Narine 's explosive 109 off 56 deliveries propelled KKR to a commanding total of 223/6, Buttler showcased immense grit and determination.Despite evident signs of discomfort towards the end, Buttler spearheaded Rajasthan Royals' charge, smashing an unbeaten 107 off just 60 balls.Former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh showered praise on Buttler for his heroic display, labeling him a 'special player'.However, Harbhajan also slammed Riyan Parag , who impressed with a brisk 34 off 14 deliveries but then carelessly surrendered his wicket to Harshit Rana."He (Buttler) is a special player. He is a different-level player. He is calm and composed. Whenever he got the chance, he hit sixes, fours and grabbed singles and doubles. When the other players are getting out, it is important to hold your batting and play your own game. A lot of youngsters need to learn from Buttler's innings. Riyan is a talented player. He scored 34 runs but this is how matches are won. You need to be there, you need to hold the fort," Harbhajan told Star Sports."You have that clear mindset to play which shot to play against which bowler. This is not the first time Jos Buttler has done it. He has done this several times and I am sure we will see him do this a lot more time in the future as well. He is one of the legends of the game," the former spinner said.Rajasthan Royals, who are on top of the points tally with 6 wins and 1 loss in 7 matches, will face Lucknow Super Giants at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow on April 27.
Article Summary: Jos Buttler leads Rajasthan Royals to record chase against Kolkata Knight Riders. Former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh hails Buttler as a'special player' Riyan Parag also praised for his display but then lost his wicket.

Article Title: Candidates Chess: Gukesh joins Nepo, Nakamura at the top
Article Text: Hikaru Nakamura is hoping that either he or his American compatriot Fabiano Caruana will end Ian Nepomniachtchi’s run of 40 unbeaten games in the last three Candidates tournament. Even if that doesn’t happen over the course of next two days (Saturday and Sunday) in Toronto, India’s 17-year-old D Gukesh is well placed to get a shot at the title. For, his own compatriot R Praggnanandhaa held Nepo to a draw in the 12th round on Thursday before Friday’s rest day.That meant Gukesh’s win over Nijat Abasov with black pieces took him to pole position with 33-year-old Nepo on 7.5 points and two rounds to go.Nakamura, 36, joined them by beating Frenchman Alireza Firouzja for a three-way tie.As Gukesh’s another countrymate Vidit Gujrathi lost to Fabiano Caruana (7 points), it gave a fresh lease of life to the latter’s campaign. Caruana is just half a point behind the three leaders in this eight-player field.With no place for numeric tiebreak and the provision for rapid tiebreaks (on Monday night) if the players on top tally same number points after 14 rounds, things are set for exciting climax.The pairings of the Candidates are made in such a way that players of same nationality won’t play against each other in the last rounds, thanks to Bobby Fischer’s allegations of fixed draws by the Soviet players in the Candidates cycle of 1962-63. But Pragg can help Gukesh’s cause by getting half a point or full point against Caruana on Saturday.Now, it’s a case of four players — three veteran elite GMs and one fearless youngster — in the reckoning to challenge world champion Ding Liren of China for the World crown later this year.Nakamura, the oldest player in the meet, has won four of the last five games, underlining his jaw-dropping fighting spirit. In the same phase, Nepo and Gukesh have won one and two games respectively.The FIDE presenter asked three leaders about the factors that would play decisive role in the remaining two rounds.Nakamura said, “Probably experience.” Caruana said, “Nerves. And you will need some luck too since you can’t win games if your opponent plays perfectly.”Gukesh said, “A bit of everything, including luck. The person who plays well and manages to remain focused, will have a pretty good chance.”
Article Summary: Hikaru Nakamura is hoping that either he or Fabiano Caruana will end Ian Nepomniachtchi's run of 40 unbeaten games in the last three Candidates tournament. India’s 17-year-old D Gukesh is well placed to get a shot at the title. Caruana is just half a point behind the three leaders in this eight- player field.

Article Title: Odisha FC come from behind to reach ISL semis
Article Text: KOLKATA: The first knockout of Indian Super League Playoffs lived up to its billing as an extra-time winner from Isak Vanlalruatfela on Friday earned Odisha FC a place in the two-legged semifinal against Mohun Bagan Super Giants .In a show of grit in Bhubaneswar, Sergio Lobera’s hosts held on against a more impressive Kerala Blasters to claim the playoff clash 2-1 to the joy of the home crowd at Kalinga Stadium after the tie ended 1-1 in regulation time.Both teams began with earnestness for the spot in the semifinal against the Shield champions. But the defenders, on both sides, looked to have brought a little more of it on the pitch as they denied attacks to be reflected on the scoreline.While Odisha ended up with better possession in the first half, the only shot on goal came from Blasters’ Hormipam Ruivah in the 22nd minute when he headed a superb cross from Freddy Lallawmawma straight into the hands of Amrinder Singh in Odisha goal.Odisha once again relied on their talisman Ahmed Jahouh to keep creating moves from deep but all those attacks were foiled by the Marko Leskovic and Milos Drincic-led Kerala defence inside the D. The story was being played in the same vein at the other end too, with both teams missing that final touch or shot in the final third in search of a breakthrough.The highlight of the opening 45 minutes was the drama that followed Mourtada Fall sending in the ball with a casual back heel on connecting with a Jahouh cross from the left of the box. While it was first given a goal by the referee, after consultation with the linesman and vehement protests from Blasters, the decision was overturned with Jahouh and Fall both found to be offside.Despite some desperate attempts from both teams to change the scoreline, they left the field for the break with the first knockout of the playoff stage goalless.Jahouh kept sending in measured crosses into the centre and the flank after the change of ends as Amey Ranawade and Jerry Mawihmingthanga kept attempting to make a goal out of them. But Blasters soon took charge of the game with a barrage of attacks near the Odisha goal.Mohammed Aimen and Saurav Mandal displayed the youthful vigour that Ivan Vukomanovic’s team rode this season but it was Fedor Cernych who broke the deadlock in the 67th minute. Aimen sent a pass to the Lithuanian after a delicate first touch as Cernych made no mistake in finding the corner of the net to the right of Amrinder.It was a well-deserved goal for the visitors but they could only maintain the lead for 20 minutes.With Blasters’ injured custodian Lara Sharma taken off field in a stretcher and replaced by Karanjit Sharma, Odisha took advantage of the lapse in focus of the opposition defence as Diego Mauricio scored his 11th goal of the season. He turned in a delectable cross from the right from current top scorer Roy Krishna and brought the home team back in the game and took it into extra time.And it was a replay of the equaliser in the seventh minute of extra time with Jahouh, once again, the conductor of the move. The Moroccan sent an inch-perfect long ball to Krishna on the right of the box and Isak only had to tap it in past Karanjit to break Blasters’ hearts.
Article Summary: Isak Vanlalruatfela's extra-time winner earns Odisha FC a place in the two- legged semifinal against Mohun Bagan Super Giants. Sergio Lobera’s hosts held on against a more impressive Kerala Blasters to claim the playoff clash 2-1.

Article Title: 'If anything stops MS Dhoni, it will be...' - reckons former CSK teammate
Article Text:
(Inputs from PTI)

NEW DELHI: Former India batter Robin Uthappa appears to be enjoying Mahendra Singh Dhoni's sustained excellence, noting that only his physical condition might halt his illustrious career.Uthappa praised Dhoni's stellar performances in the ongoing IPL season, especially his recent explosive cameo against Lucknow Super Giants , where he scored 28 off just nine balls."The only thing stopping him is his health.His fitness will be the only thing that stops him from playing any further. He loves the game, is deeply passionate about it, and wants to continue playing it. If there's anything that will stop him, it will be his own body that will give way. The mind is staying up to date," Uthappa remarked on JioCinema.Dhoni's impactful knock included a four and a six off Mohsin Khan, followed by another maximum off Yash Thakur. Former India pace spearhead Zaheer Khan lauded Dhoni's growing influence and exceptional performance, describing his presence on the field as phenomenal.In the same match, Ravindra Jadeja 's unbeaten 57, coupled with contributions from Moeen Ali (30 off 20) and Dhoni, propelled CSK to a competitive total of 176 for six. However, Lucknow Super Giants, led byKL Rahul 's commanding 82 and Quinton de Kock 's 54, clinched victory with a record-breaking partnership of 134 runs.Uthappa also lauded Rahul's innings, expressing confidence in his chances of making it to the T20 World Cup squad. He commended Rahul's disciplined approach.ALSO SEE: IPL 2024 RESULTS "Over the last couple of weeks, I thought he wouldn't figure in the World Cup squad. But if he continues batting the way he is right now, he'll find himself a spot," Uthappa said.
Article Summary: Mahendra Singh Dhoni scored 28 off just nine balls against Lucknow Super Giants. Former India batter Robin Uthappa praised Dhoni's stellar performances in the ongoing IPL season. Zaheer Khan also lauded Dhoni, describing his presence as phenomenal.

Article Title: Boston Red Sox dominate Pittsburgh Pirates in 8-1 victory
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: The Boston Red Sox put on an offensive clinic in their 8-1 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Friday, fueled by strong performances from several players, including Wilyer Abreu , Rob Refsnyder , and Ceddanne Rafaela .Abreu led the charge with a 3-for-5 performance at the plate, including a powerful home run that set the tone for Boston's early dominance.Refsnyder and Rafaela also contributed significantly, each hitting their first home runs of the season and driving in a pair of runs.Triston Casas added another home run for the Red Sox, while Enmanuel Valdez delivered a crucial two-run double to further extend Boston's lead.On the mound, Brayan Bello delivered a stellar performance, allowing only one hit and two walks while striking out seven over six innings. Chase Anderson and MLB debutant Cam Booser provided solid relief to preserve the lead and secure the victory for Boston.The Red Sox wasted no time getting on the scoreboard, scoring two runs in the first inning and adding another in the second. They continued to pile on the runs throughout the game, showcasing their offensive prowess with a total of 12 hits.Despite a late run by the Pirates in the ninth inning, the Red Sox's dominant performance was too much for Pittsburgh to overcome. Boston's pitching and hitting were firing on all cylinders, resulting in an impressive victory and their second win in a three-game span.
Article Summary: Boston Red Sox put on an offensive clinic in their 8-1 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates. Wilyer Abreu led the charge with a 3-for-5 performance at the plate. Rob Refsnyder and Ceddanne Rafaela each hit their first home runs of the season.

Article Title: Juan Soto's heroics lead New York Yankees to victory over Tampa Bay Rays
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Juan Soto was the hero for the New York Yankees as they secured a 5-3 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays on Friday night. Soto's three-run homer in the seventh inning capped off a five-run rally for the Yankees, who took advantage of defensive miscues by the Rays.The game-changing sequence started with errors by Tampa Bay's Curtis Mead and Yandy Diaz in the seventh inning.Mead's botched grounder allowed Alex Verdugo to reach base, while Diaz's error allowed Jose Trevino to reach safely and set the stage for the Yankees' comeback.After Anthony Volpe's RBI single broke the tie, Soto delivered the decisive blow with a towering home run into the second deck in right field off Rays pitcher Chris Devenski.Soto, who also made a spectacular leaping catch at the right-field fence earlier in the game, showcased his all-around talent and played a pivotal role in the Yankees' victory.Despite a strong start by Tampa Bay's Tyler Alexander , who limited the Yankees to just two hits over 5 1/3 innings, the Rays couldn't hold off the Yankees' late surge.Clarke Schmidt started for the Yankees and delivered a solid performance, allowing just one run on seven hits over 5 1/3 innings.Dennis Santana picked up the win in relief, while Clay Holmes sealed the victory with a game-ending double play to secure his eighth save of the season.The Rays' offense was led by Richie Palacios , who homered in the sixth inning, and Issac Paredes, who drove in two runs with a single in the eighth inning. However, their efforts weren't enough to overcome the Yankees' late rally and defensive prowess.With the win, the Yankees improved to 14-6 on the season and continued their strong start to the campaign.
Article Summary: Juan Soto was the hero for the New York Yankees as they secured a 5-3 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays on Friday night. Soto's three-run homer in the seventh inning capped off a five-run rally for the Yankees, who took advantage of defensive miscues by the Rays.

Article Title: Why Quinton de Kock's wife shared 'Apple Watch warning' during Chennai Super Kings vs Lucknow SuperGiants IPL match
Article Text:
Apple Watch warning about dangerous noise levels



What is Apple Watch Noise alert

As MS Dhoni , the revered Chennai Super Kings (CSK) icon, marched onto the pitch, a wave of electric anticipation swept through the Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow. The legendary cricketer’s arrival was met with a thunderous ovation that resonated beyond the confines of the arena, stirring the souls of cricket enthusiasts.On this particular Friday, the atmosphere was charged with an intense emotion as Dhoni faced the Lucknow SuperGiants (LSG).The stadium, awash in a sea of CSK’s signature yellow, buzzed with the possibility that this might be ‘Thala’ Dhoni’s final IPL appearance in the City of Nawabs.Capturing the moment’s intensity, Sasha, the wife of cricketer Quinton de Kock , shared an Instagram story that spoke volumes. Her post featured a snapshot of her smartwatch alerting to “Loud Environment: Sound levels hit 95 decibels,” a testament to the roaring support for Dhoni that could potentially lead to temporary hearing loss after mere minutes of exposure.The crescendo of cheers set the stage for Dhoni’s masterclass in batting. The 42-year-old maestro unleashed a spectacular onslaught, hammering the LSG bowlers for an unbeaten 28 runs off just nine deliveries. His powerful performance, punctuated by three boundaries and two majestic sixes, captivated the audience and showcased his enduring prowess.This remarkable cameo not only electrified the spectators but also etched Dhoni’s name deeper into IPL history, as he crossed the milestone of 5,000 runs as a wicketkeeper-batsman in the league.Throughout the current IPL season, Dhoni has been in formidable form, maintaining an undefeated streak and amassing 87 runs with an extraordinary strike rate exceeding 255. His sustained excellence and ability to control the game’s rhythm affirm his status as one of cricket’s all-time greats.The Noise app on Apple Watch measures the ambient sound levels in your environment using the microphone and duration of exposure. When Apple Watch detects that the decibel level has risen to a point where hearing could be affected, it notifies the users with a tap on the wrist.
Article Summary: MS Dhoni scored 28 runs off just nine deliveries against Lucknow SuperGiants. Wife of Quinton de Kock shared a snapshot of her smartwatch alerting to “Loud Environment: Sound levels hit 95 decibels,” a testament to the roaring support.

Article Title: Why is MS Dhoni not batting up the order for CSK? Coach Stephen Fleming reveals the reason
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Whenever Mahendra Singh Dhoni steps onto the field, fans anticipate thrilling performances from the legendary cricketer, whether he stands behind the stumps to keep wickets or in front to smash the bowlers. And the former India and Chennai Super Kings ' ( CSK ) skipper hasn't disappointed this Indian Premier League (IPL) seaaon on any count.Dhoni has been in outstanding form during IPL 2024 , sending bowlers on a leather hunt while scoring at a strike rate of 255.88.In the match against the Delhi Capitals in Visakhapatnam, Dhoni came in to bat at number 8 and scored an unbeaten 37 off 16 balls, including four boundaries and three sixes.The Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, where India famously clinched the 2011 ODI World Cup title with Dhoni hitting the winning six, was once again awaiting 'Mahi Magic', and he did not disappoint the fans.Dhoni blasted three consecutive sixes off Hardik Pandya, scoring an impressive 20* runs from just four deliveries.In CSK's last match against the Lucknow Super Giants, Dhoni delivered another powerful performance, scoring 28 runs off just nine balls. His unbeaten innings included three fours and two sixes.Despite his excellent form and ability to rapidly increase the run-rate, it remains unclear why Dhoni is not batting up the order for CSK this season.While explaining the reason, CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said: "It is inspirational, his batting this season, even in the nets, has been very crisp and the team is not surprised to see what he is doing. His skill level during the pre-season was very high. Other years he had a problem with his knee and he is still recovering, which is why there are only a certain amount of balls he can function well. I think everyone wants to see him for longer as we do, but that amount of time is right; we need him for the tournament.""That 2-3 over cameo, he is owning that space, it is up to the rest of the batting unit to get us sort of in a good position where he can push us over the top and he is doing that pretty much every time at the moment, which is great to watch and what an amazing atmosphere when he comes out and entertains. We are incredibly proud of what he has achieved and we marvel at the amount of love that he gets. We are incredibly proud that he is part of our side and he is pretty much the heartbeat of our side," Fleming said after the match against LSG.CSK, who visited Lucknow on the back of two consecutive wins, suffered their third defeat in the tournament, but retained their third position on the points table.CSK will face Lucknow Super Giants again on April 23, but this time as hosts in Chennai.
Article Summary: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has been in outstanding form during IPL 2024. The former India and Chennai Super Kings skipper has scored at a strike rate of 255.88. It remains unclear why Dhoni is not batting up the order for CSK this season.

Article Title: KL Rahul: India's T20 World Cup squad: Former Mumbai Indians star makes big comment on KL Rahul's future
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former Mumbai Indians fast bowler Mitchell McClenaghan believes that Lucknow Super Giants captain KL Rahul has always been in contention for a place in India's 15-player squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup , which begins on June 1 in the USA and the West Indies.KL Rahul made his cricketing comeback after experiencing right quadriceps pain during India's loss in the first Test against England earlier this year.Rahul was brought on as an impact substitute against the Punjab Kings as the LSG management aimed to ease him back from his injury.Before his impressive innings of 82 from 53 balls against the Chennai Super Kings, Rahul struggled to accumulate runs, averaging 34 with 204 runs in six matches. His form raised doubts about his selection for the prestigious tournament.McClenaghan stated that Rahul has consistently been a strong contender for a spot in the eagerly anticipated competition."Well, I think KL has always been a contender; it is just how well he performs in the IPL leading up to the competition. This is a very significant performance. I think his spirit will be high. I think the main thing on which he will be focusing right now is the spirit of his team. I think it is a massive win; it is a huge win, in fact, in terms of where they are in the points table," the former New Zealand pacer said on ESPNcricinfo.Former Australian cricketer Tom Moody believes that with his blitzkrieg, the LSG skipper, who recently turned 32, has put his name on the table for a spot in the team."There is a cue in that particular department that the top-order batter but keeper also. He has certainly put his name on the table," Moody added.LSG will now head to Chennai to take on CSK once more in their next match.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants captain KL Rahul has always been in contention for a place in India's 15-player squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Former Mumbai Indians fast bowler Mitchell McClenaghan believes that Rahul has consistently been a strong contender for a spot.

Article Title: BCCI fines KL Rahul and Ruturaj Gaikwad Rs 12 lakh each after LSG vs CSK IPL match
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) has levied fines against Lucknow Super Giants and Chennai Super Kings for maintaining a slow over rate during their recent IPL encounter on Friday.The captains of both teams, KL Rahul and Ruturaj Gaikwad , have been penalized with fines amounting to INR 12 Lakh each.The BCCI, in an official statement, announced, "KL Rahul, captain, Lucknow Super Giants has been fined after his team maintained a slow over-rate during Match 34 of the Indian Premier League 2024 against Chennai Super Kings at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow."Similarly, regarding Ruturaj Gaikwad, the statement read, "Ruturaj Gaikwad, captain, Chennai Super Kings has been fined after his team maintained a slow over-rate against Lucknow Super Giants."Both the captains were fined a minimum amount as it was their first offence of the season.KL Rahul's fine comes despite his stellar performance in the match, where he claimed the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock of 82 off 53 balls. His partnership with Quinton de Kock steered Lucknow Super Giants to a commanding 8-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings, amassing the highest opening partnership of the season in the process.Contrastingly, Ruturaj Gaikwad's situation is less favorable, as his team faced defeat, and his personal contribution with the bat remained modest, scoring 17 off 13 deliveries.After the match, Lucknow Super Giants, Chennai Super Kings, Kolkata Knight Riders, and Sunrisers Hyderabad all currently tied at 8 points each. The race for playoff berths tightens further with KKR and SRH having played one match less, setting the stage for a thrilling culmination to the tournament.
Article Summary: The Board of Control for Cricket in India has levied fines against Lucknow Super Giants and Chennai Super Kings. The captains of both teams, KL Rahul and Ruturaj Gaikwad, have been penalized with fines amounting to INR 12 Lakh each.

Article Title: 'Aur inhe Champions Trophy host karni hai': With rain and no roof, Pakistan cricket fans forced to go under plastic sheets for shelter

Article Title: A “Jeevan Gaurav Puraskar” for Sunil Gavaskar in San Jose, California
Article Text: It's been almost 37 years since he retired from the game, but Sunil Gavaskar continues to get tremendous recognition both in India and abroad. The cricket legend, who first stormed the cricketing world with a magnificent show with the bat in his debut series against the West Indies in 1971, has a massive fan following across the cricketing world and beyond.In recognition of his yeoman service to cricket for the last 50 years and more, the Bruhan Maharashtra Mandal (BMM) in the USA has chosen him for the Jeevan Puraskar, an award that will be conferred upon him at a four-day function in San Jose, California from June 27 to 30. The BMM represents 54 marathi organisations in North America.In a video bmm have posted on Instagram, Gavaskar says, “I’m delighted to know that I’m being honoured with the Jeevan Gaurav Puraskar at the BMM convention in San Jose between June 27-30. Its also a wonderful opportunity for me to meet up with the Maharashtrian community in the USA, as well as the neighbouring countries, and to be able to interact with them about my life and my career. Hopefully, it will also be a double celebration of sorts, with India winning the T20 World Cup in USA in June, and so, it should be great fun there. I hope to catch up with you, look forward to see you all at the convention in San Jose.”Since he quit the game as a player, Gavaskar has virtually become the voice of India cricket through his peerless commentary. The 74-year-old is involved with charity work, mainly through the Sri Sathya Sai Sanjeevani Hospital, and also helps needy sportspersons through his CHAMPS foundation .The BMM’s biennial event in California is likely to be attended by prominent personalities from India and people from Maharashtra who have settled in the USA. During the four-day gathering, Gavaskar, who will be in the USA to commentate in the ICC Men’s Twenty20 World Cup in New York and Florida, will give a speech and interact with the audience in Marathi and English.
Article Summary: Sunil Gavaskar will be honoured by the Bruhan Maharashtra Mandal (BMM) in the USA. The award will be conferred upon him at a four-day function in San Jose, California from June 27 to 30. The BMM represents 54 marathi organisations in North America. The 74-year-old is involved with charity work through his CHAMPS foundation.

Article Title: 'If 'Impact Player' rule is not there in internationals, then why being used in IPL?'
Article Text:
IPL 2024

:

|

ALSO READ:

MUMBAI: The ‘ Impact Player ’ rule, which has been under-fire from some quarters, including Indian captain Rohit Sharma and India pace stalwart Zaheer Khan, in IPL-2024 as it makes things difficult for the bowlers and isn’t in operation in international cricket , should be scrapped from the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy onwards from the next season, as it is hampering the growth of domestic allrounders, feels former Mumbai wicketkeeper Sulakshan Kulkarni , who was the head coach of Tamil Nadu last season.“Recently, I was asked for a few suggestions to improve domestic cricket by the BCCI, and I’ve recommended that the ‘Impact Player’ rule should be scrapped from the Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy from next season onwards,” Kulkarni told TOI.“If this rule isn’t in place in international cricket, which means that it wont be there in the T20 World Cup, why is it being used in IPL?,” he added.Explaining why he doesn’t approve of the rule, which allows for a player to be substituted at any stage of the match, Kulkarni said: “It’s a rule which will ensure that we won’t develop all-rounders in domestic cricket. Look at Shivam Dube’s example. He bowled a fair bit in the Ranji Trophy this season (he took 12 wickets for Mumbai in five matches at an average of 12.08), but has not bowled a single ball in the IPL this time (even in the last IPL, when the Impact Player rule came into effect, Dube didn’t bowls a single over). If he doesn’t bowl in the IPL, how does he make a case to be picked for Team India in the T20 World Cup as an allrounder."Even the likes of Venkatesh Iyer, who has played as an allrounder for the Indian team, has picked wickets for Madhya Pradesh in the Ranji Trophy this season (eight wickets in eight matches at an average of 19.50) and Riyan Parag are not getting to bowl in the IPL. The only Indian allrounder who is bowling is Hardik Pandya, and he too is in poor bowling form.”In blazing form in the IPL season with the bat, Parag took 11 wickets each in the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy and in the Deodhar Trophy (both white-ball tournaments) for Assam and East Zone, besides performing well as a batsman.The Mumbaikar pointed out that the plethora of 200-plus scores being made and chased in this IPL was directly due to this rule, introduced by the BCCI last season.“It has made the contest between the bat and ball lop-sided and boring. Now, you suddenly have a big-hitter walking in the death overs, which makes things uphill for the bowlers,” Kulkarni said.During this batsman-dominated IPL, voices against the Impact Player rule have grown louder.“The ‘impact sub’ has been a worthwhile trial but I feel it’s time to revert to just playing XI’s. The sub has created an imbalance between bat and ball, it also covers up for poor selection and auction strategy ,” former Australian allrounder and Sunrisers Hyderabad coach Tom Moody posted on ‘X’.“Ppl what are your thoughts on the impact player?? I for one think it has to go...too much depth in the batting which gives teams the security and the freedom to go hard and hence these crazy scores. Why would I want to be a bowler in the future if this is where the game is heading,” former India batsman Hemang Badani had posted on ‘X’.
Article Summary: Sulakshan Kulkarni feels Impact Player rule is hampering growth of domestic allrounders. Former Mumbai wicketkeeper says it has made the contest between the bat and ball lop-sided and boring. “Impact Player’ rule should be scrapped from the Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy from next season onwards,” he says.

Article Title: 'He walks in and...': KL Rahul says MS Dhoni's 'intimidation' factor put his bowlers under pressure
Article Text:
(With inputs from PTI)

NEW DELHI: It was MS Dhoni mania once again, this time at the Ekana Stadium as the Chennai Super Kings talisman pulled off an incredible 9-ball 28 not out cameo, delighting the Lucknow fans on Friday.The hosts had kept things under control before Dhoni and Moeen Ali (30 off 20) went on a six-hitting spree at the death to take CSK to a fighting 176 for six.But despite leaking runs in the final over, Lucknow Super Giants restricted Chennai to a moderate total and then pulled off the chase comfortably with 6 balls to spare.Skipper Rahul led from the front with a whirlwind 53-ball 82 as Lucknow beat CSK for their fourth win of the season.After the match, KL admitted that his bowers leaked extra runs at the death as they were swayed away by Dhoni's presense in the middle. Rahul admitted that his young bowlers got under pressure by the Dhoni's presence."160-165 would have been ideal but yah again its MSD (smiles). He walks in and the pressure gets to the bowlers. That's the presense and intimidation he has had over teams and bowlers. We have a young team and I think it was the first time they were put under pressure by huge figure like MS. Crowd was really relly loud. But I still thought they stuck to their plans. He is a phenominal player to still hit them for sixes. Yeah, 15-20 runs extra but we knew if we bat well we can chase it down," Rahul said at the post-match presentation.Rahul, the leader, had a good day in office as he was spot-on with his bowling changes and also took two catches and affected a stumping before returning to smash a match-winning 82."Feels good at the end of the day, When you win, looks like you make all the decisions right," said Player of the Match Rahul."Impossible to get all right. Depends on the kind of wicket we are playing on and the kind of batters there are. We spend time doing homework on tactics and strategy and we spoke about them not settling against one style of bowling," he added.Chasing 177, Rahul (82) and De Kock (54) batted with authority during their match-winning alliance of 134, the highest partnership for any wicket at the Ekana Stadium, as LSG scored 180 for 2 in 19 overs."Felt that if we bat well, we could chase it down. I have been trying to assess the situation and today it came off. With Chennai's spinners, they tried to put brakes on us," Rahul said."We tried to get to a good start. Tried to take them down, luckily it came off. When your partnership goes on, you can take a few more chances. Glad that it happened."Ruturaj Gaikwad, the CSK captain, said his team was 10-15 runs short with dew coming in."We finished off very well, couldn't have asked for more. But after powerplay, we couldn't kick on till 14-15th over. We lost wickets regularly and were 10-15 short."Slightly difficult to bat but with Impact Player rule you need an extra batter. With dew coming on later, felt 180-190 could have been good."CSK bowlers couldn't produce a breakthrough as Rahul and De Kock batted well in the powerplay and Gaikwad agreed they needed to bowl better in the first six overs."[Bowling in the powerplay] is one area we would like to improve, puts opposition on the back foot if we can get wickets in the powerplay. Good to play them again soon, will come back with homework done," he said.The two teams will again face off on April 23 at Chepauk.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants beat Chennai Super Kings by six wickets. MS Dhoni pulls off incredible 9-ball 28 not out cameo at the Ekana Stadium. LSG restricted Chennai to a moderate total and then pulled off the chase comfortably with 6 balls to spare. Rahul (82) and De Kock (54) batted with authority during their 134-run alliance.

Article Title: KL Rahul fires a dazzling 53-ball 82, pips MS Dhoni to this IPL record
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Lucknow Super Giants ' KL Rahul hit a sizzling 53-ball 82 as the skipper led from the front, taking his side to a commanding eight-wicket win over Chennai Super Kings on Friday.Firing his second half-century of the season, Rahul looked class apart during his stay in the middle as he perfectly steered Lucknow's 177 chase for a fourth win of the season.Laced with 9 fours and three hits into the stands, Rahul knock came at a strike rate of over 154 as it helped LSG secure an easy win with 6 balls to spare.During his sumptuous fifty, Rahul overtook MS Dhoni on the list of designated wicketkeeper-batters to have most 50-plus scores in the IPL Rahul now has 25 fifty-plus scores in the league, followed by Dhoni -- 24.Quinton de Kock (23), Dinesh Karthik (21) and now-retired Robin Uthappa (18) are other three keeper-batters in top-five of the list.Chasing 177 for victory, Rahul and de Kock (54) added a solid 134-run opening stand which is now the third highest opening partnerships vs CSK in the IPL.The 134 stand is now also the second highest partnerships for LSG for any wicket in the IPL after their 210* against Kolkata Knight Riders (KL Rahul & Quinton de Kock - in 2022)."I felt that if we bat well, we could chase it down... when your partnership goes on, you can take a few more chances. Glad that it happened," said Rahul after the match.
Article Summary: KL Rahul hits 82 as Lucknow Super Giants beat Chennai Super Kings by eight wickets. Rahul overtakes MS Dhoni on list of designated wicketkeeper-batters to have most 50-plus scores in the IPL. Rahul and Quinton de Kock added 134-run opening stand which is now the third highest opening partnerships vs CSK.

Article Title: Roma down Milan to seal Europa League semi-final spot as Bayer Leverkusen also progress
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Liverpool 's hopes of securing a treble of trophies under Jurgen Klopp were dashed as they failed to overturn a three-goal deficit against Atalanta in the Europa League quarterfinals.Despite winning the second leg 1-0 at home, the Reds' efforts proved insufficient, and they were eliminated from the competition on aggregate.Klopp acknowledged Atalanta's deserved progression, stating, "We won the game and that was the reaction we wanted to show.It was difficult and we knew it would be, but Atalanta deserve to go through, 100%."Meanwhile, Bayer Leverkusen remained on course for an unprecedented treble after holding West Ham to a 1-1 draw in London, advancing to the semifinals with a 3-1 aggregate victory. Xabi Alonso's team extended their unbeaten streak to 44 games and will face Roma in the last four.Roma secured their semifinal spot by defeating AC Milan 2-1, progressing 3-1 on aggregate. Daniele De Rossi's contract extension was marked by his team's resilience, despite being reduced to ten men.In the Europa Conference League, Aston Villa emerged victorious in a penalty shootout against Lille, securing a 4-3 win to advance to the semifinals. Emiliano Martínez saved two spot-kicks, and Douglas Luiz converted the decisive penalty, propelling Villa into their first European semifinal since 1982. They will face Olympiakos, who overcame Fenerbahce on penalties. Fiorentina , last year's runners-up, also reached the semifinals after defeating Viktoria Plzeň 2-0 in extra time. They will face Club Brugge , who won 2-0 at PAOK to advance 3-0 on aggregate.
Article Summary: Liverpool fail to overturn a three-goal deficit against Atalanta in Europa League. Bayer Leverkusen remain on course for an unprecedented treble after holding West Ham to a 1-1 draw in London. Aston Villa emerge victorious in a penalty shootout against Lille, securing a 4-3 win to advance to the semifinals.

Article Title: Liverpool face Europa League elimination despite 1-0 win as Atalanta qualify for semi-finals
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Atalanta have made it to the Europa League semi-finals despite a 1-0 defeat to Liverpool , thanks to a 3-1 aggregate win. This victory brings them closer to their first European final.In the first leg, Atalanta shocked Liverpool with a 3-0 win at Anfield, dashing Liverpool's European hopes under manager Juergen Klopp in his last season.Klopp praised his team's commitment and desire, despite the loss.He expressed mixed emotions, acknowledging the end of their European journey and the focus now shifting to the Premier League ."We gave ourselves a massive hurdle (in the first leg), but I liked the game a lot for a long time, the commitment, the desire, the power the boys showed was incredible," Klopp told TNT Sports."It is mixed emotions. We would have wished that we could have gone to Dublin (for the final), but that hasn't happened.Liverpool's early goal by Mohammed Salah in the second leg sparked hope, but Atalanta, led by Gian Piero Gasperini, withstood the pressure to secure their semi-final spot against Olympique de Marseille.Gasperini highlighted the importance of victory, even when fraught with danger."If you don't win without danger, there's no glory to your triumph," Gasperini said."The fans always ask us for the shirt to be soaked in sweat, and that's one thing we must have at a minimum."Salah missed a crucial opportunity to double Liverpool's lead, and a penalty appeal was turned down, leading to frustration for Liverpool.Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk admitted Atalanta deserved to progress and emphasized the need for Liverpool to rebound in the Premier League."Last week we were very poor and they had a good game," Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk told TNT Sports. "They deserved to go through because we made it far too difficult for ourselves."Tonight was a good game and we showed great fight. It was an improvement but the reality is we are out. We are disappointed to be out of the competition as we really wanted to win it."Liverpool, tied with Arsenal at 71 points and close to league leaders Manchester City, now focus on their upcoming match against Fulham. Van Dijk called for unity and resilience for the final push in the league.
Article Summary: Atalanta beat Liverpool 1-0 in second leg to reach Europa League semi-finals. Atalanta won 3-1 on aggregate and will face Olympique de Marseille. Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp praised his team's commitment and desire.

Article Title: Emiliano Martinez's antics work as Aston Villa beat Lille to make Europa Conference League semi-final
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Aston Villa goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez emerged as the hero, guiding his team to the semi-finals through a dramatic penalty shootout victory over French club Lille in a thrilling Europa Conference League quarter-final second-leg encounter.The match itself was a rollercoaster ride, ending 3-3 on aggregate after Lille's 2-1 win on the night.However, the real drama unfolded during the penalty shootout, where Martinez found himself at the center of attention.Martinez, known for his antics and mind games, saved two crucial penalties, showcasing his exceptional goalkeeping skills. However, his persistent reactions towards the French fans led to a bizarre incident where he was initially shown a second yellow card, seemingly resulting in a red card and subsequent dismissal.Remarkably, Martinez was reprieved due to a rule that states yellow cards awarded during regular time are not carried forward to penalty shootouts. This allowed him to continue his heroics, ultimately proving instrumental in Villa's 4-3 shootout triumph.Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praised Martinez's mentality and leadership, acknowledging his importance to the team both on and off the pitch. Emery expressed pride in his goalkeeper's performance and the team's overall achievement."He is very important for us. He has his personality and his personality in the dressing room is very important because he is a leader with his experiences," Emery said of his keeper."He has a really brilliant mentality. And then on the pitch he has his personality and he played fantastic. He saved two penalty shots so of course I am very proud of him. I am very proud of all the players."Villa's victory marked a significant milestone, as they became the first English team to reach a European semi-final since 1982. Additionally, they are now the sole remaining English representative in European competitions this season, following the exits of Liverpool and West Ham United from the Europa League.
Article Summary: Aston Villa beat Lille 4-3 on penalties in Europa League quarter-final second- leg. Goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez saved two crucial penalties. Villa are the first English team to reach a European semi-final since 1982. Unai Emery praised Martinez's mentality and leadership.

Article Title: ISL: Odisha plot a KO punch on Blasters at Kalinga
Article Text: KOLKATA: With the all-important League Shield finally grabbed by Mohun Bagan Super Giants following their dramatic 2-1 win over defending champions and leaders Mumbai City FC in the last league match this Monday, Indian Super League ( ISL ) enters the knockout stage on Friday with the one-legged playoff involving the two sides who were in the lead at different stages of the season.With three losses and a win and a draw each in their last five ISL outings, hosts Odisha FC and Kerala Blasters FC will vie to keep their championship hopes alive when they face off at Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar on Friday.Odisha, fighting for the Shield till a few weeks ago, ended up fourth on the standings due to a sudden loss of form towards the end of league stage. Blasters, on the other hand, drifted away from the top spot gradually and finished fifth on the table despite having a great start. Inconsistency, coupled with injuries to important players at crucial juncture, have plagued the Blasters' performance.However, despite their recent poor form, Sergio Lobera's Odisha will start the first playoff as favourites simply because of their enviable home record this season. The Juggernauts have rolled on undefeated on home turf, having collected 27 points from 11 matches, with eight wins and three draws. And on Friday, they will be eager to notch their ninth win at home this season for a place in two-legged semis against the Mariners. Lobera will have a full-strength squad at his disposal for landing a knockout punch on their rivals in the do-or-die game.Asked about missing out on the Shield, Lobera said on Thursday, "We need to finish the season to do a very good analysis. I am very proud of my players. We competed against the strongest teams in India and reached the final in Kalinga Super Cup."In terms of the Shield, we did an amazing season. We competed till the end in a very good way. We need to focus on tomorrow's (Friday) game against Kerala Blasters and show we're ready to compete. There are no problems. We are competing against another team with the same targets. Hopefully, we can reach the semifinals and show everyone we are ready to compete against every team and in every competition,” the Spaniard added ahead of the game.Asked about having any advantage over the Blasters, whom they defeated in the last meeting at home, the gaffer said, "The past is not helpful for the playoffs. We need to forget what happened before and focus on tomorrow's game. The team who is smarter, especially during bad moments, has more options to win. The message to the players is to enjoy this moment."Blasters defender Naocha Singh Huidrom is unavailable for the clash as the 24-year-old was handed a three-match suspension by the All India Football Federation disciplinary committee for a headbutt incident during the game against East Bengal FC earlier this month.Asked about their preparations for the game, Blasters head coach Ivan Vukomanovic said, "During the season we had to completely change the squad due to issues such as surgeries to key players and other uncontrollable factors. But after the season (league stage) the mentality is completely different in the knockouts, as you don't have to plan for the long term here."
Article Summary: Odisha FC and Kerala Blasters FC will vie to keep their championship hopes alive when they face off at Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar on Friday. Mohun Bagan Super Giants finally grabbed the all-important League Shield following their dramatic 2-1 win over defending champions and leaders Mumbai City FC.

Article Title: How could six teams from Bundesliga qualify for UEFA Champions League 2024/25 season?
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Bundesliga , Germany's top-flight football league, has found itself in a complex situation for determining the teams that qualify for European competitions, particularly the prestigious Champions League . The number of qualifying spots can vary depending on the performance of German teams in the current season's European competitions.Traditionally, the top four teams in the Bundesliga qualify for the Champions League.However, due to the revamped format of the Champions League, which will expand from 32 to 36 teams starting next season, Germany could potentially have five or even six teams in the competition.Two additional Champions League spots will be awarded to the leagues whose teams perform best in European competitions this season. Based on current standings, these spots are likely to go to Italy and Germany, whose teams have performed well in the Champions League and Europa League .The situation becomes even more complex when considering the potential scenarios involving teams like Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund, who have reached the Champions League semifinals. If Dortmund were to win the Champions League but finish fifth in the Bundesliga, they would automatically qualify as the defending champions, and Germany would receive a sixth Champions League spot.The battle for European qualification in the Bundesliga is a moving target, with teams like RB Leipzig, Eintracht Frankfurt, and SC Freiburg vying for positions that could secure them a place in the Champions League, Europa League, or Europa Conference League. Even teams like Augsburg, currently seventh, could potentially qualify for the Champions League, depending on the outcomes of various matches and competitions.The Europa League and Europa Conference League qualifications are equally uncertain, as they depend on the results of the German Cup final and the final positions in the Bundesliga table. Remarkably, even second-division club Kaiserslautern could qualify for the Europa League if they manage to win the German Cup against Bayer Leverkusen While the top and bottom of the Bundesliga table provide some clarity, with Leverkusen already crowned champions and Darmstadt facing relegation, the battle for European qualification remains a complex and ever-changing scenario that will likely continue until the final weeks of the season and even after the Bundesliga campaign concludes on May 18.The uncertainty surrounding European qualification in the Bundesliga highlights the competitiveness and unpredictability of the league, as well as the impact of the revamped Champions League format on the qualification process. Teams and fans alike will have to remain patient and adaptable as the final standings and European qualifiers are determined in the coming weeks.
Article Summary: Germany's top-flight football league has found itself in a complex situation for determining the teams that qualify for European competitions. The number of qualifying spots can vary depending on the performance of German teams in the current season's European competition. The battle for European qualification in the Bundesliga is a moving target, with teams like RB Leipzig vying for positions.

Article Title: Antonio Ruediger throws the decisive blow as Real Madrid beat Manchester City to enter Champions League semi-final
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Real Madrid clinched a heart-stopping 4-3 shootout triumph over Manchester City , propelling them to the Champions League semi-finals after a gripping 4-4 aggregate tie in extra time.Manager Carlo Ancelotti lauded their tenacity, emphasizing the relentless fight they displayed. Madrid's skipper Nacho expressed sheer joy at their advancement, describing the moment as a childhood dream come true."We started well, went ahead and then we had to fight to survive, we had to suffer. City had control because we defended too deep," Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti told Movistar. "By the time the penalty shootout came, we were totally convinced we'd go through."This is about the only way you can come to City and win. You work, sacrifice and win however you can."Despite City's dominance, Madrid seized the lead through Rodrygo 's early strike, a moment of relief amid City's relentless pressure. City's Kevin De Bruyne equalized, but Madrid's resilience shone through, leading to a thrilling penalty shootout.Guardiola praised Madrid's defensive solidarity despite City's exceptional performance. Madrid's triumph sets up a tantalizing semi-final clash with Bayern Munich."Congratulations to Real Madrid, they defend so deep, with incredible solidarity," Guardiola said. "We did everything. I have no regrets about what we've done."Defensively, offensively, we played exceptional in all departments, in everything, and unfortunately we couldn't win, so that's what it is."Reflecting on their victory, Jude Bellingham highlighted Ancelotti's influence in fostering freedom and confidence among the players."Our biggest strength is he (manager Carlo Ancelotti) finds a way to let a lot of boys play with freedom. We're so off the cuff," Bellingham said. "As a man he fills you with calmness and confidence. I caught him yawning and he said to go out and excite him."You have to see it as a responsibility not a pressure if you want to play for a team like Real Madrid. Today it came down to mentality."City, meanwhile, must swiftly recover as they face Chelsea in the FA Cup semi-finals, holding a slender lead in the Premier League. On the other hand, the stage is set for an exhilarating semi-final showdown between Borussia Dortmund and Paris Saint-Germain.
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Manchester City 4-3 on penalties to reach Champions League semi-finals. Madrid's triumph sets up a tantalizing semi-final clash with Bayern Munich. Borussia Dortmund and Paris Saint-Germain will also meet in the last four.

Article Title: Captain's role doesn't make much difference: AITA secretary Dhupar on India's BJK Cup performance
Article Text: PUNE: The Indian women's failure to qualify for the Billie Jean King Cup Playoffs has brought the focus on captain Shalini Thakur and coach Radhika Tulpule but the All India Tennis Association believes the players have to step up."The girls did well. I think after winning the first (singles) match against New Zealand, we should have won the tie," said AITA honorary secretary Anil Dhupar on Thursday.India finished third after the 1-2 loss to New Zealand in the final round-robin clash of the Asia-Oceania zonal competition in China last week.Winning the tie would have placed the team second in final standings, thereby securing them a spot in the Playoffs in November."We are remaining in Group 1, but I was expecting to qualify," said Dhupar but then switched to highlighting the association's efforts in hosting tournaments through the season to help players gain ranking points."The association has done everything. The girls have had the opportunity to get a lot of points, and we had organised a camp in China."And they were all playing well. Ankita had just won a tournament (in doubles) in Japan just the week before."Dhupar, however, brushed aside the questionable team combinations fielded by the captain and the coach.After entering Sahaja Yamalapalli in singles and pairing Rutuja Bhosale with Prarthana Thombare against the strong Chinese team, the team's think-tank opted to put Rutuja in singles and hand Ankita the additional duty of doubles for the remaining three ties.It proved to be disastrous as it left Ankita with little time to recover with only a 30-minute gap between second singles and the decisive doubles matches. Ankita ended up with a 1-4 win-loss record in singles for the week, the lone win coming against a weak Pacific Oceania in the opening round.Ankita could have been relieved of the burden a bit by way of giving a day's rest, especially when Sahaja and Shrivalli Rashmikaa had served notice of their potential by upsetting top-100 players in the WTA 125K Series event in Mumbai just two months ago.Nandan Bal, the chairman of selectors, provided some perspective. "If I were the coach or the captain, and if I find my No. 1 player not performing, I would put my No. 3 or any other player in," Bal, a former Davis Cup player, said."Try something different, think out of the box. It could have meant Rutuja being the No. 1 player, but since she is playing well, why not try?"The AITA secretary had a totally different outlook, though."A captain's role does not make much difference," said Dhupar categorically, adding that the players were capable of taking the workload.Importantly, the AITA has rejected the players' request -- most recently during a meeting called by Dhupar himself on the sidelines of an ITF event in Indore -- for a minimum of two physio-therapists to handle the requirements of five players in the team through the week."They (the women players) are just asking what the boys (Davis Cup team) are getting. I think one physio is enough, and there has been no official, written request from the captain or the players to the association so far," Dhupar said."They are playing 40 tournaments a year without a physio, but when they play for the team, they want everything."Bal refused to make a direct comment on the team management's performance."The selection committee only picks the players. The captain, the coach and the support staff are appointed by the executive committee of the AITA," he said.Both captain Shalini Thakur and coach Radhika Tulpule did not respond to request for a comment.
Article Summary: India finished third after the 1-2 loss to New Zealand in the final round-robin clash of the Asia-Oceania zonal competition in China last week. The All India Tennis Association believes the players have to step up. Captain Shalini Thakur and coach Radhika Tulpule did not respond to request for a comment.

Article Title: French Open the moment to 'give everything': Rafael Nadal after Barcelona defeat
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal expressed his determination to give his all at the upcoming French Open , describing it as the moment to "give everything and die" on the court.Nadal's return from injury in Barcelona was cut short by Alex de Minaur , with the Australian defeating him 7-5, 6-1 in the second round.The 22-time Grand Slam champion, who missed most of the 2023 season, is aiming to compete at Roland Garros in May, where he has triumphed a record 14 times.Nadal, aged 37, sees this as a pivotal moment, targeting his return to the French Open as the time to fully commit, acknowledging that it may be the final year of his illustrious career.The Spaniard said the clash with De Minaur was not the moment he was saving himself for, instead targeting his Roland Garros return as the time to go for broke in what he expects will be the last year of his career."On a personal level, for what is to come, the 6-1 in the second set is what had to happen today," said Nadal, who explained there were bigger challenges ahead."It wasn't today that I had to give everything and die, I have to give myself the chance to do that in a few weeks, or at least try to," Nadal told reporters."I will try to take a step further in Madrid, then another one in Rome and, in Paris... there is the moment to do it, whatever happens, there is no better place to."Nadal said the key to being able to triumph at Roland Garros was continuing to build in the weeks ahead."(I need to be) getting the weeks of experience, of matches, and feeling more comfortable with everything," continued Nadal."Today I felt more comfortable than yesterday ... I have to be realistic, today I cannot have a game that goes for two and a half hours, or three."Nadal, a 12-time champion at the Barcelona clay-court tournament, cruised past Flavio Cobolli in his first ATP Tour match since January. However, his journey was halted by Alex de Minaur, who has now secured victories in their last two encounters.Despite showcasing glimpses of his unparalleled skill on the court named after him, Nadal succumbed to defeat in what he described as "realistically" his final appearance at the tournament.De Minaur seized an early break in the first game and applied pressure with a series of exquisite drop shots, leaving Nadal struggling to retrieve them.Although Nadal fought back with a break of his own, taking a 4-3 lead, De Minaur responded by breaking to love and clinching the first set 6-5.The momentum shifted in favour of the 25-year-old Australian, who dominated the second set by breaking Nadal three times and ultimately sealing victory as Nadal's shot went long."I'm sad because nobody wants Rafa to stop playing," said De Minaur."I never thought I'd get a win over Rafa on clay, it's something I'll be able to say when I finish my career."Earlier Norway's three-time Grand Slam finalist Casper Ruud came out on top in an entertaining 6-3, 6-4 match with Alexandre Muller to reach the third round.The 25-year-old Norwegian, runner up at the Monte Carlo Masters last week, was broken twice in the first set and allowed Muller to save 10 of 14 break points. Despite his sloppiness Ruud still took the set.The third seed looked to have sealed the match when he broke his French journeyman opponent in the third game of the second set.However, the world number six gave up four break points while serving for the match to allow 27-year-old Muller back in at 5-4.Ruud, though, was more clinical in the next game, breaking Muller to progress with his 25th victory in 2024 and will face Jordan Thompson in the next round."This year is much better than last year, I'm having a good year," said Ruud, who defeated world number one Novak Djokovic last week.Monte Carlo Masters winner Stefanos Tsitsipas dispatched Sebastian Ofner in straight sets with a 6-4, 7-5 victory.(With AFP inputs)
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal says he will give his all at the upcoming French Open. Nadal's return from injury was cut short by Alex de Minaur 7-5, 6-1 in the second round. The 22-time Grand Slam champion is aiming to compete at Roland Garros in May.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal comeback ends in Barcelona Open second round
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal experienced his first setback since returning to tennis following an injury, as he was defeated 7-5, 6-1 by Alex de Minaur in the second round of the Barcelona Open on Wednesday.The 22-time Grand Slam champion, who has been sidelined for three months, made a commendable effort on his comeback but ultimately succumbed to the relentless performance of Australia's world number 11.Nadal, 37, missed nearly the entire 2023 season due to injury and is now aiming to compete at the French Open in May, where he holds the record for being the 14-time champion.The Spanish tennis star, who boasts an impressive record of 12 Barcelona clay-court titles, comfortably defeated Flavio Cobolli in his first ATP Tour match since January on Tuesday.However, he acknowledged that he wasn't the favorite against De Minaur, who has now emerged victorious in their last two encounters, despite the Spaniard's former world number one status.It proved a far tougher challenge and despite showing flashes of his supreme quality on the court named after him, Nadal came up short in what he said he believes is his final appearance at the tournament.The Australian broke in the first game and tested Nadal with a series of brilliant drop shots which Nadal could not reach.However Nadal hit back with a break of his own in the sixth game and consolidated with a fizzing backhand for a 4-3 lead.De Minaur broke to love to take a 6-5 lead as Nadal went wide and sealed the first set when the Spaniard pushed a shot into the net, winning the final 10 points as Nadal started to struggle.The 25-year-old Australian broke for a 2-1 lead in the second set when Nadal could not return a powerful passing shot, and secured another break for 4-1.De Minaur wrapped up his emphatic second set performance with a third break when Nadal went long.Monte Carlo Masters champion Stefanos Tsitsipas faces Sebastian Ofner later Wednesday in the second round.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal beaten 7-5, 6-1 by Alex de Minaur in the second round of the Barcelona Open. The 22-time Grand Slam champion made a commendable effort on his comeback. Nadal missed nearly the entire 2023 season due to injury.

Article Title: We could have qualified for Billie Jean King Cup playoffs: Rutuja Bhosale
Article Text: PUNE: It was personally a successful week for Rutuja Bhosale but the 28-year-old felt the Indian team "could have qualified" for the Playoffs of the Billie Jean King Cup women's team tennis competition.The Indian team suffered an agonising 1-2 loss to New Zealand in the final round of the Asia-Oceania Group 1 matches in Changsha, China, last Saturday to finish third in the six-team duel.The top two teams -- hosts China and South Korea -- advanced to the Playoffs in November while India and New Zealand stayed in Group 1. Chinese Taipei and Pacific Oceania were relegated to Group 2.Rutuja won all her four matches in singles and her only loss of the week came in the one doubles match she was paired with Prarthana Thombare against the all-conquering Chinese."For me, it was a very positive week, especially after the ankle injury I had in Mumbai (during the WTA 125K Series event)," Rutuja said from Shenzhen, where she continued her exploits to win her first-round match in the $40K ITF event."I didn't think I would be playing singles, but Sahaja had blisters and the captain ( Shalini Thakur ) and the coach (Radhika Tulpule Kanitkar) thought I had the experience, they trusted me."In contrast to Rutuja's 100 percent record in the week, India No. 1 Ankita Raina had a below-par outing by her standards, winning just one of her five singles matches, although the World No. 255 had to double up for doubles duty as well.Two of Ankita's singles losses came against players whom Rutuja had beaten -- South Korea's Sujeong Jang (World No. 267) and New Zealand's Lulu Sun (167)."We could have qualified. The last day was very stressful. Ankita was a little bit tired, and it rained, so matches were moved indoors," Rutuja said."It was clay but not the best like the one we played outdoors. The clay was coming off and you could see the (hard) surface beneath. We had to stay focussed."And New Zealand (doubles team of World No. 5 and US Open winner Erin Routliffe and Paige Hourigan) played their best match of the week."We had seen them play in the previous matches, and we were wondering if they were really World No. 5."But against Ankita and Prarthana, they took the first set 6-1 in no time and went up 5-1 in the second. We made it 5-5 but they didn't really allow us to get back into the game."It was a tough week but everyone gave their best."Rutuja praised Ankita for showing courage to play back to back matches each day, but felt resting her a day could have helped the player's as well as the team's fortunes."It was stressful for her. But credit to her, she stepped up to play both singles and doubles. Against Chinese Taipei, she had a long singles match (nearly two and a half hours) and then played doubles (after a 30-minute gap)," Rutuja said."Shalini ma'am and Radhika ma'am asked her if she could play, and she said she was ready."She could have been rested one day, maybe against Korea (the day after playing Chinese Taipei). There were a lot of options."
Article Summary: Rutuja Bhosale says Indian team "could have qualified" for the Playoffs of the Billie Jean King Cup. Indian team suffered an agonising 1-2 loss to New Zealand in the final round of the Asia-Oceania Group 1 matches in Changsha, China.

Article Title: Naomi Osaka beaten in first round in Rouen on clay return
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Naomi Osaka , a four-time Grand Slam champion, faced a surprising defeat in the first round of the WTA event in Rouen on Wednesday, succumbing 6-4, 6-2 to Italian Martina Trevisan .This marked Osaka's first appearance on clay since the 2022 French Open , where she exited in the opening round while Trevisan reached the semifinals.After returning to action in January following a 15-month hiatus from the tour due to maternity leave, the former world number one expressed her desire to compete in the Paris Olympics However, she might need to undergo an appeals process due to her failure to meet the mandatory requirement of two appearances for Japan in the Billie Jean King Cup during the current Games cycle.Since her comeback, Osaka's world ranking has climbed from 831 to 192, yet she has not progressed beyond the quarter-finals in any of the seven tournaments she has participated in.In the match against Trevisan, Osaka struggled to capitalize on her break chances, converting only one out of eight opportunities in the opening set. Despite a resilient effort, Trevisan claimed victory by breaking Osaka twice in the second set, securing her second win in nine tour-level matches this year.Trevisan's next challenge will be Ukrainian third seed Anhelina Kalinina in the last 16.
Article Summary: Naomi Osaka loses 6-4, 6-2 to Italian Martina Trevisan in first round of WTA event in Rouen. This marked Osaka's first appearance on clay since the 2022 French Open. Osaka returned to action in January following a 15-month hiatus from the tour due to maternity leave.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal wins on injury comeback at Barcelona Open
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Making a triumphant return from injury, Rafael Nadal demonstrated his dominance at the Barcelona Open on Tuesday by swiftly dispatching Flavio Cobolli .The 22-time Grand Slam champion, who hadn't competed in an ATP Tour match since January, secured a convincing 6-2, 6-3 victory over the Italian in just one hour and 25 minutes, advancing to the second round.Nadal, aged 37, relished the opportunity to compete on clay for the first time since his triumphant French Open win in 2022. Despite the hiatus, he showcased glimpses of his customary brilliance, delivering a solid performance that hinted at his enduring prowess on the court."It was a good start -- when you return you can't get rid of the doubts in one day, above all, on a physical level," Nadal told TVE."Within what it could be, it was a good first round. He made mistakes and I think I played the game that I had to play."Nadal, the unparalleled champion with a record 14 triumphs at Roland Garros, is eagerly anticipating his potential participation in May's event, which he anticipates will mark the concluding chapter of his illustrious professional career.The clay court maestro, who endured a significant portion of 2023 sidelined due to injury, is set to take onAlex de Minaur on Wednesday following his effortless victory over Cobolli."It will be at a speed that I don't know if I will be able to keep up with, but I'll try," Nadal said of facing the 11th-ranked De Minaur.After initially facing a 30-0 deficit due to a double fault, Nadal swiftly regained his composure and found his rhythm on the court, capitalising on the fervent support from the crowd in the stadium named in his honor, which seemed to unsettle Cobolli.Nadal seized control of the match by converting his third break point in the fourth game, securing a 3-1 lead. Despite Cobolli's resilience, holding serve at 4-2 down, Nadal's relentless pressure eventually paid off as he broke once again to claim the set in just 43 minutes, punctuating the victory with a triumphant fist pump.Entering the second set, Cobolli's game faltered, conceding a break for a 2-0 lead to Nadal, courtesy of two unforced errors. Though Cobolli managed to break back in the third game, Nadal quickly regained the advantage with another break for a 3-1 lead, aided by Cobolli's third double fault. Nadal efficiently served out the set to secure the triumph.Despite his victory, Nadal's performance on serve was solid yet subdued, lacking in aces and explosive power, yet effective enough to outmaneuver his opponent and claim the win."I've gone months without being able to serve, (and) although I've got a lot of excitement to play here and do the best I can, I'm not going to go crazy with the serve," added Nadal."I have to serve with caution that the moment I'm in dictates... there are moments in which I feel more liberated and others in which I'm more careful."
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal beats Flavio Cobolli 6-2, 6-3 in first round of Barcelona Open. The Spaniard hadn't played since January due to injury. Nadal will take on Alex de Minaur in the second round on Wednesday.
